com.pinterest.pinit
Class PinItButton

java.lang.Object
  android.view.View
      android.widget.ImageView
          com.pinterest.pinit.PinItButton
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback
public class PinItButton
extends android.widget.ImageView

PinItButton is a drop in PinIt button for use with Android in Java or XML based layouts. You must obtain a developer ID at http://pinterest.com prior to usage.

Usage:

// Per session
PinItButton.setPartnerId("YOUR_PARTNER_ID_HERE");
PinItButton.setDebugMode(); // optional

// Per instance
PinItButton btn = new PinItButton(getContext());
-or-
PinItButton btn = (PinItButton) findViewById(R.id.pinit);
btn.setImageUrl("http://placekitten.com/400/300");
btn.setUrl("http://placekitten.com");
btn.setDescription("A place kitten!"); // optional

Version:
1.0
Author:
Pinterest, Inc, Carl Rice

setDescription

public void setDescription(String description)
Optional This is only a suggestion and some users may change this text. Tip: Adding a price in the description will signal this is an item for purchase.

Parameters:
description - a suggested Pin description

setImageUri

public void setImageUri(android.net.Uri imageUri)
Required if PinIt.setImageUrl(String) was not called. The uri of the image file you'd like to Pin.

Parameters:
imageUri - the uri of the image to Pin

setImageUrl

public void setImageUrl(String imageUrl)
Required if PinIt.setImageUri(Uri) was not called. The url of the image file you'd like to Pin.

Parameters:
imageUrl - the url of the image to Pin

setListener

public void setListener(PinItListener listener)
Set a listener to receive callbacks on actions that occur within this class

Parameters:
listener - a PinItListener

setPartnerId

public static void setPartnerId(String partnerId)
Required This ensures you are a registered partner and allows us to track which Pins are coming from your app.

Parameters:
partnerId - your partner id

setUrl

public void setUrl(String url)
Required if PinIt.setImageUrl(String) was called. Optional if using PinIt.setImageUri(Uri). The url the Pin will link to. For example a product or detail page. It is highly recommended you set this as it will drive traffic back to the intended source page.

Parameters:
url - the url the Pin will link to
